title: "dromen (expositie 1)" invitation - Lucida Sans, ??? {Stephen}
content:
Hello everyone,

I was wondering if someone could help me. I used two different fonts for this invitation. I think one of them is “Poetica” (don’t know for sure) and the other? I made this by hand (cutting out the letters and sticking them onto another piece of paper and making a copy of that), so there is no electronic file left too look at.

I want to make a new invitation using the same type, but I want to make it in Indesign at my school so if your looking at this and have an opinion about the (mis)use of these two fonts together feel free to comment.

Thanks for reading any help greatly appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [uitnodiging.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830010013/http:/typophile.com/files/uitnodiging.pdf) | 174.95 KB |

 [‹ pls help recognize typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830010013/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18331 "Go to previous forum topic") [looking for a font for an non-existant language ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830010013/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18304 "Go to next forum topic")
author: canus

comments.content: Thank you so much. I have been asking several people for the last month and we could not remember or deduce wich font it was. I’m going to write it down from now on so I can remember.

Poetica is a bit narrow compared to your sample.  
Tim
Tim, do you have a suggestion which font it could be?

I’m sorry I don’t, Poetica is close just looks a bit narrow, at least the letters do the numerals look about right, could you have expanded them slightly?  
Best answer is to try posting it in the type i.d. forum and see if anyone can positively id it.  
Tim

thanks Tim,

I will do that.

One of the moderators already did it for me. Thank you.
